name: subway geishas
description:
executed 2001
digital, housepaint, acrylic, acetate on paper
57” x 30”

reimagining an amalgamation of tryptics by meiji era japanese artist toyohara chikanobu in the subway of tokyo. 

paralleling the arrival of the black ships commanded by william perry and the re-opening of the japanese borders to the outside world, this work symbolized a transition of my work from the analog to digital worlds.

@antiquefuture | justin r wood
